GYMKHANA AWARDS 2018-19

The Annual Gymkhana Awards Ceremony is scheduled to be held on 12th April (Friday), 6:30 pm onwards in Kalidas Auditorium. 

Technology Students' Gymkhana congratulates all the students who are going to be felicitated. The link of the Awardees has been attached below.

The Dress code for the ceremony is Formals (including Blazers) and has to be followed strictly by every recipient considering the significance of the event. 

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ylJg-UZX24QNnWS0BnHP56RszBWfEmNOLWV7zSAVXAA/edit?usp=sharing

Gymkhana Awards 2018-19

Applications for the Gymkhana Awards in the various genres are invited for consideration.

In the Social and Cultural field:
1. Ashok Mukherjee Cup
2. Srimati Chandramani Cup
3. Alumni Cup (non graduating batch)
4. Institute Order of Merit
5. Honorable Mention
6. Special Mention

In the resume, following information can be included:
*  Inter IIT Participation and achievement(s) if any
*  Participation in the Social and Cultural General Championship and achievement(s) if any.
*  Any inter college competition(s) that you may have participated in
*  Positions of Responsibility held at the Gymkhana/Hall or any other organisation in the Institute.
*  Participation in Cultural events (eg. Spring Fest, outstation participation)

Mail your resumes and relevant documents (for the verification of credentials) to tsg.socult@gmail.com.

Technology field:
1. G.S. Sanyal Cup 
2. Institute Order of Merit
3. Honourable Mention

In the resumes following information can be included:
*  Inter IIT Participation and achievement if any
*  Participation in the Technology General Championship and achievement if any
*  National/International Conference, International Competitions and achievement if any.
*  Meaningful projects and technical paper.
*  Positions of Responsibility held at the Gymkhana or any other organisation in the Institute.
*  Participation in tech events (eg. Kshitij, outstation participation)

Mail your resumes and relevant documents (for the verification of credentials) to tech.gymkhana@gmail.com.

Sports and Games field:
1. Bhandarkar Cup (Best Outgoing All rounder)
2. Institute Blue 
3. Honourable Mention 
4. Special Mention 
5. Ashoke Mukherjee Cup (Outgoing student who has made outstanding voluntary contribution to the Gymkhana)
6. Alumni Cup (Best Sportsmen in the current year) - only non-graduating students are eligible to apply.
7. Ankik Dhar Trophy (Graduating all rounder with involvement in all three events Sports and Games, Social and Cultural and Technology and exceptional performance in at least one of them)

In the resumes following information can be included:
1.Inter IIT Participation and achievement if any.
2.Inter College/University Participation and achievement if any
3.Participation in various standard tournaments as a student of IIT Kharagpur and achievement if any.
4.Positions of responsibility held in the Gymkhana.
5.Any other contribution to IIT Kharagpur (Institute level).

Mail your Sports resumes and relevant documents to gsecsportsiitkgp@gmail.com at the earliest.

Any student awarded punishment by the Standing Disciplinary Committee of the Institute / Examination Malpractice Prevention Committee of the institute shall not be eligible for Gymkhana awards.

Application Deadline - 10th April 2019 by 1 PM.

No applications beyond the deadline will be accepted.

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared a post. EDIT - The earlier post mentioned the time as 4PM. It has been changed to 2:30PM. Please take note of that. Holla peeps! So another year passes by, and its time for one of the holiest Quiz Club rituals, The GGSO or the Green...errr... The Great Governor Send Off Quiz. The outgoing governors, namely, Amit, Harsh and, Mohit are going to conduct the last quiz of the season and will be revealing the new governors of the Club, or as we fondly know them, the Secretaries of the Politburo. Hoping to see you tomorrow at 2:30 PM at V2, for a fun, workoutable and grand quiz! Cheers, and Happy Quizzing! :)

Artbeat is at hand and its the perfect opportunity to showcase your artworks alongside others. Whether you are an in-class doodler or a hidden artist, Spectra The Fine Arts and Design Group of IIT Kharagpur, invites you to submit your artworks for 'Artbeat', the annual art exhibition of IIT Kharagpur.

To submit your artworks fill out this form: https://tinyurl.com/Artbeat2019
Artbeat gives all creative and artistic people a platform to showcase their work in this exhibition. 
Traditional art, Digital art, Photography or any other form of art is welcomed.

Medall Behavioural Health Services (Chennai) in collaboration with Counselling Center and Institute Wellness Group is organizing a mental health awareness programme. The programme would also include a session on stress management and ways to enhance coping skills.

You are cordially invited for the event on 3 rd of April 2019 at S. N Bose Auditorium, 6 PM onwards. Please spread the word among your friends and we will be happy to meet all of you.

Please register on the counselling center website. The links are as follows:
1. http://www.counsellingcentre.iitkgp.ac.in/ 
or

2. Directly with the URL [ http://www.counsellingcentre.iitkgp.ac.in/registration/ ]

Often there has been a issue raised that Autumn semester, which is deprived of student community events, becomes tedious- flooded with the pressure of CDC and Placements for senior students and jammed with AP, Illumination for juniors. 

The elected Office successors of the Gymkhana post- G.Sec. Students Welfare invites suggestions from the student community to present ideas for tentative events to be carried out in the Autumn Semester under two fundamental categories- "Awareness events"and "Interaction events". 

So get on with your creativity but also remember to take care of the feasibility(budget, logistics etc.). The most feasible and interesting ideas would be selected. Also, you can volunteer for your event and work together with us if it is chosen for execution.

Form for your suggestions: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1cSntRrWtXcC1H6r9xbZYssDYNRh-HDcMQaIle6Bp9qg/edit

Form for your suggestions: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1cSntRrWtXcC1H6r9xbZYssDYNRh-HDcMQaIle6Bp9qg/edit

AIESEC in IIT Kharagpur in collaboration with Disha Seema Centre Public School is organizing a social initiative Balakalakaar on 31st March to empower underprivileged children to help them explore their true potential and showcase their talent. The daylong event includes an art and craft competition, games, painting, singing, and dancing activities and a feast for the children. 
All students of IIT Kharagpur are welcome to join for Balakalakaar on 31st March at Disha Seema Centre Public School from 8:00 A.M till 6 P.M.
You can also contribute to make this initiative possible and support our cause. Go to Balakalakaar crowdfunding link https://www.ketto.org/fundraiser/bkk2019_iitkgp ”
Let’s join hands to give these little children hope, a hope that they can create themselves a better future.

Inter IIT Alumni Play, Fun & Networking Event - Badminton and TT Tournament, an event of Pan IIT Alumni India - North, supported by Alumni Associations of various IIT's, will be held on 13th & 14th April, 2019 at AC Badminton & TT Halls, Noida Stadium, Noida. 

It is open to all IIT Alumni, their families, "IIT Faculty & Students"
 for Under 15, Under 25, 25-40, 40-55, 55-65 and 65+ age categories for both Men & Women. 

Participation KIT includes -
Premium T-Shirt 
Discount Coupons
Snack Box 
Exciting Prizes

Limited Spots, REGISTER TODAY at 

Registration Badminton - 
https://www.yogems.com/event/2nd-inter-iit-alumni-badminton-championship-play-fun-network-04-2019

Registration TT -
https://www.yogems.com/event/2nd-inter-iit-alumni-table-tennis-championship-play-fun-and-network-04-2019

Registration deadline - April 07, 2019

There are 4 courts each of Badminton and Table Tennis. 
Court 1: Exhibition matches amongst IIT Directors & Distinguished   IIT alumni
Court 2 & 3: Tournament
Court 4: Practice

All IIT alumni, faculty and students are most welcome to witness the mega sports event of  IIT alumni, network and encourage the participants. 
Please call Puneet Mathur 9810454499, 9810581197 for any queries.
Feel free to forward it to all your IIT friends and groups and make it a grand networking event.

Ensuring quality higher education is one of the most important things we can do for future generations. With this in mind, International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is delighted to organize the MS PhD panel discussion on the 27th of March, 2019. Do join in to hear from our esteemed panelist about how they got MS/PhD offers from top class universities and clear out all doubts you have regarding pursuing higher education. 
We'll see you in V3 (Vikramshila Complex) at 6:30 pm sharp on the 27th of March, 2019.

Kindly spare a couple of minutes to read through and another couple of minutes to fill the form below.

As each of us are very well aware about the importance of IIT Kharagpur as a Higher Technical Institution towards the nation and the reason why students' at IIT Kharagpur need to be transformed into the best citizens that they can ever be, a comprehensive set of CODEs which govern the activities and attitude of the students and other stakeholders on campus is really crucial to guide and ensure excellence on campus in all domains.

Humanities and Social Sciences, IIT Kharagpur has approached this need to create a set of CODEs in a scientific way and for the same wishes to have inputs from various stakeholders of the institute (students, alumni, faculty and staff) through various means.

As a part of the same, kindly fill in the form with attention and also ensure all their colleagues have contributed to the same.
http://tinyurl.com/codeiitkgpsurvey
  

Thanks for your time and consideration.

The festival of Indain cricket is here and what better way to flag it off than a Live Screening on the weekend!! Amidst the festive flair of Holi and the buzz of hall days, Technology Students Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur presents the inaugural match of Indian Premier League 2019. So will it be the yellow army's Whistle Podu or the men in red Playing Bold, come out in numbers and find it out yourselves! 
Technology Students' Gymkhana thanks Technology Films Society, for their support!

IIT Kharagpur hosts over 10,000 of the brightest minds in the world. But when these minds come together to interact, exchange ideas or discuss, instances and severity of factors like self-consciousness and peer pressure are more. Vanchhit Rai explores some of the typical, yet completely avoidable scenarios and suggests ways to work around it and ensure a happy and peaceful existence . Follow the link-
http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2019/03/18/summer_sorted/

Announcement

There will be a UPSC guidance session from Mr. P. K. Mukherjee. 

Date: Today, 16th March
Time: 12 noon
Place: F-234

Please go through the attached message sent by him to know more.

-----Forwarded message-----

I am P. K. Mukherjee(an Engg & MGMNT professional) now retd. Presently associated with an NGO a social organisation working for the welfare/upliftment/of students from all communities as guides/mentors/career counselors. Our NGO is targeting IIT Engineers who are looking at IAS as an alternate career option.Since such students are unable to pursue such an hectic Coaching for IAS of 8/9 months duration at an exorbitant cost of 
Rs.4-5lacs(incl.of B/L) by so called commercial Institutes. The need was felt by the Trustees of this NGO to provide a capsule Residential course of 60 days duration during summer vacations at very reasonable cost,wherein we will cover the syllabus in 600 hrs by the best faculties available at New Delhi. Incidentally every year IIT Engineers from this Residential prog.are making into IAS & other Allied Services.
Numbers are going up constantly.

Quant Club, IIT Kharagpur in association with WorldQuant is organizing a workshop on Quantitative Finance on 16th March 2019 at V4 from 1 pm - 4 pm. 

There are no pre-requisites and the workshop is open to all departments and years. Srinjoy from WorldQuant will guide through the basics of Quantitative Finance with hands-on implementation in hedge fund trading strategies. The workshop will be followed by International Quant Championship (IQC) for the upcoming weeks, one of the largest quant competitions in the world.

Please follow the facebook page of Quant Club, IIT Kharagpur for updates about the workshop.

All of us deep down probably yearn to express ourselves better. That deep desire to put into words what we feel inside. But not all of us have to luxury of doing it with such ease. Luckily, it is not something you cant learn with practice.

This March 14, 8:00 PM, Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is organizing Content Writing Workshop at Raman Auditorium and a chance to learn from professional editors at IIT Kharagpur, with more than 20 years of experience, what it is like to have a free-flowing pen and take away valuable tips to help us capture our readers' attention better.

Ps:-All are welcome. It is best for beginners and intermediates. Interested people are encouraged to bring along their own work for discussion. Keep it healthy.

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared a post. The 4th IIT Students' Council Meet was held on 9th and 10th March, 2019. The meet was attended by members from 12 different IITs and was witness to a varied set of agenda points - some addressing pressing pan-IIT issues, while others envisioning more collaboration and learning from each other. A number of pan-IIT resolutions were also passed, which will be worked on by member IIT councils. Here are some pictures of the meet:

message:
For all UPSC aspirants out there!
Since the notification for this year is on, many of you might be in some dilemma. To your rescue, Student Welfare Group brings a seminar on Career in Civil Services in association with Next IAS. 
The guest speaker for the evening will be Mr. Shubham Aggarwal (IRS-2016, IPS-2017). Shubham is a Computer Science Engineer from NIT Allahabad and started his preparation for the Civil Services Exam early in his college years. Soon after college, he appeared for the UPSC CSE exam and has achieved back to back success in it.
Do carry all your doubts and get them clarified with him. Do not miss this sincere chance.
See you!
Venue: V2, Vikramshila
Time & Date: 5:45 pm, 14th March

TEDxIITKharagpur presents to you the first speaker for this year's Talks, Mr. Sumit Sadawarti  

Sumit is a jazz/soul singer/songwriter who was the only artist to represent India on the semifinals of Asia's Got Talent 2017, where he performed with 16 Grammy-winning producer, David Foster. He then brought jazz music to India's Got Talent 2018, where he finished as a quarter-finalist. In 2016, he was featured on The Verve Magazine as a modern day icon and then became the winner of MTV India Nescafe Labs 2017. 
Sumit began singing and writing poetry at a very young age and considers the traditions of jazz, soul and gospel music as the foundations of his vocal techniques and stylings. Inspired by artists like Amy Winehouse, Aretha Franklin, Nina Simone, and Etta James, he wishes to follow in their footsteps. 

Our first winner of our scrabble is Atharva Navsalkar. The opportunity is still not lost. Be quick to find the names of remaining 5 speakers and submit them in the link provided.

https://goo.gl/forms/gDcK9m48H5Sr5OyF3

Follow us on instagram @ www.instagram.com/tedxiitkharagpur
Website : www.tedxiitkharagpur.com

#TEDXIITKharagpur
#SpeakerRelease
#5daysToGo

Benjamin Franklin has rightly said, 'By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.'
On this line of thought, Gopali Youth Welfare Society, in association with Student Welfare Group - SWG, IIT Kharagpur, is working towards building a valuable database of potential blood donors in our campus. 
Every noble soul is requested to come forward and register for the same. Let us all be prepared, as emergencies may arise at any time.

**Date- 9th March 2019 and 10th March 2019 | Venue- Respective Halls**

#beingprepared #life #safety #blooddonation #iitkharagpur #gyws #swg #welfare #socialresponsibility #helping #generosity #emergency

Hello everyone!
In honor of the memory of our late beloved alumnus from the 2015 batch, Navneet Kumar, a former captain of the Inter IIT football contingent and one of the best defenders KGP has ever seen, the Institute will be hosting a five on five (two additional substitute) football tournament at TSC on 9th and 10th of March. This is third time Institute is organizing this tournament. We hope to see you again this time with greater enthusiasm and zeal.

The winning teams will receive medals and cash prizes as mentioned :-

First Prize- 5000
Second Prize- 3000
Third Prize- 2000

You can register here for free: https://goo.gl/forms/Oqbwh9uCdfdP7T9O2

The last date of registration is 8th March, 2019.

Hurry Up!

In case of any query, feel free to contact :-
Mayank Manjeara
Secretary, Football Sub-Committee
8979569245

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT KGP Sports's post. “When it comes to self-defence, it is better to have the power and not need it than to need it and not have it.” ~ Kevin Shearer It is the undeniable truth that today we live in a world of jeopardy. One can never anticipate the time or place or the kind of attack they could encounter. In a country like India where cases of sexual violence are on the rise (out of which many go unreported), self-defence, especially for women, has become a necessity now more than ever. Hence, it is time that each woman became vigilant and competent of the different strategies to be adopted under adverse circumstances. Join us as IIT KGP Sports organises a Self Defense Camp for women on 5th, 6th & 7th March 2019. Please register at: https://goo.gl/forms/bjpubPdC1tEU6pav2 Further details will be mailed to the registered participants. For queries, contact: Mahima Karumanchi Institute Girls’ Sports Nominee, 7702288080

प्रौद्योगिकी साहित्यिक समूह प्रस्तुत करता है "काव्यांजलि", कविताओं और गीत-ग़ज़लों से छलकती हुई एक बेहतरीन शाम। काव्यांजलि को विशेष अतिथि के रूप में अपनी रचनाओं से नवाज़ेंगे हास्य-व्यंग्य के मशहूर कवि डॉ. कमलेश द्विवेदी जी और निपुण ग़ज़लकार श्री मुकेश शर्मा जी।

दिनांक : 3 मार्च (रविवार)
समय : शाम 5 बजे से 
स्थान : कालिदास प्रेक्षागृह

साहित्य के नाम होने वाली इस शाम में आप सभी का इंतेज़ार रहेगा। तो ज़रूर आइयेगा।

साभार
प्रौद्योगिकी साहित्यिक समूह
भारतीय प्रौद्योगिकी संस्थान, खड़गपुर

"IP is like Potential energy, the output depends on the force applied. Make your IP work for you." –Aoife Butler

Intellectual assets are better managed if implicit knowledge is turned into explicit knowledge, as described in invention reports and filed as a patent application. While the idea may seem to revolve around Law, they are equally significant in the domain of modern day engineering and innovation. To shed some more light on this perspective, Technology Transfer Group, along with the IPR Cell and SRIC, IIT Kharagpur, is organizing a special lecture on IPR. The lecture will focus on the different facets of IPR and their importance from an Engineer's perspective. 

Prof. Ravinder David Koilpillai, Qualcomm Institute Chair Professor of IIT Madras, will be delivering this special lecture, which will also open to a discussion with the audience. In addition to this, student inventors from IIT Kharagpur who have realized novelty through their BTP and MTP theses will also be feted during the event.

Don't miss this wonderful opportunity, and make yourself available at the Benjamin Gupta Auditorium, Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law, on 26th February at 5 pm sharp!

Aerospace giant Airbus has finally pulled the plug on its A380 Program, 13 years after the 'Superjumbo' took to the skies and left travellers, onlookers and enthusiasts awestruck. Our Editor, Ratnottam Das explores a possible reason for its demise and the consequences. But more importantly, he tries to show us the world of possibilities that lies ahead, and how air travel has changed for the better since forever.
Follow the link-
http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2019/02/16/goodbye_gentle_giant/

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Transfer Group , IIT Kharagpur's album. A sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from Magic - Arthur C.Clark IIT Kharagpur is a premier technology institute of India which is widely known for its research culture. We bring out the Tech Tribune 2019 to update the students of our Institute on the same clause. It contains the technologies developed or progressed during the year 2018. The newsletter contains a detailed analysis of the Patents filed in the year 2018 along with six identified student inventors. It also contains articles from Mr. Manish Ayushman of Chemical Engineering and from Professor M.M. Ghanghrekar of Civil department We invite you to reach out to us with suggestions, criticism, and articles at ttgiitkharagpur@gmail.com Find our Newsletter attached with the post https://drive.google.com/file/d/1219yFAIFnTHwKCLLtCvtaVE79LhElcjZ/view?usp=sharing

"ये कहानी है एक इंसान के सफर की, सफर के विभिन्न पहलुओं से जुड़े कुछ किस्सों की, ये कहानी है हम सभी की। कहानी की रचना एक कविता के रूप में की गयी है जिसमे झाकियाँ है हमारे अनेकानेक किरदारों की। आइये, ले चलता हूँ आपको कुछ पल के खातिर आप ही के शहर में।"- Bhaskar Singhania

Next on our blog we have a beautiful poem penned down by Bhaskar Singhania, where he writes about the dynamic facets of human beings with conviction :)
Link:http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2019/02/03/insaan/

"ये कहानी है एक इंसान के सफर की, सफर के विभिन्न पहलुओं से जुड़े कुछ किस्सों की, ये कहानी है हम सभी की। कहानी की रचना एक कविता के रूप में की गयी है जिसमे झाकियाँ है हमारे अनेकानेक किरदारों की। आइये, ले चलता हूँ आपको कुछ पल के खातिर आप ही के शहर में।"- Bhaskar Singhania

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Roobaroo Productions's post. Hello All! We are here with an announcement for the fellow KGPians. For the people interested in doing Stand Up and who have never found any help regarding it, this is your chance! The PunchLine Club here is an initiative by Rishabh Gupta and Vaibhav Gambhir. We wish to perform with you in the open mic and promote the Stand Up culture here. We want people to share their experiences with each other. Starting from the basics to the completion of your piece, going through the entire process, we will work and perform together. Interested people, please fill this form. Google Form Link: http://bit.ly/StandUpKGP Let's get together, express our hearts out in the language of humor and spread the smile.
story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Roobaroo Productions's post.

To
The Managing Director
Mr. Kshitij Jain
Exide Life Insurance
Bangalore-560001
(M)9587010318

Sub: Request to cancel my policy no:03747894 and refund Premium
Immediately

Respected  Sir,

This has reference to my above complaint I am sending you mail by explaining in details: 

I beg to state that myself Mrs. Kalpana Dutta is residing at 2/63 Vidyasagar Colony, Naktala, P.S- Netaji Nagar thana, Vidyasagar Colony Bus Stand, Kolkata - 700047 is complaining against Exide Life Insurance and their employee Baburam Mahapatra (BM, Exidelife of Golpark branch, Kolkata).

They cheated me by taking my hard earned money which I got from my sale of house property. They told me that to take one time(single)   policy from Exide Life insurance which would be as like as bank FD and I would get Rs. 24000/- PM as interest. They told me that it could be encash anytime whenever I wish as like as bank FD.

When I received policy bond I went Golpark branch, Exide Life Insurance, Kolkata office immediately to cancel that policy as below mentioned reasons:

1. My signature made fraud by Exide employee

2. Income which had written in proposal form that also fraud as I am a house wife

3. Business which had written in proposal form that also fraud as I have no business

4. I have several diseases I.e. hypertension, diabetes, hi blood pressure and many more, I have also heart disease which I told your BM but he had not mentioned anything in proposal form.

I requested your BM, Baburam Mahapatra to cancel my policy several times that day I received your policy bond within free look period. But he forced me not to do so. And he confirmed me for Interest of Rs.24000/-.

When I had not received any interest which he had committed to me Rs.24000/-pm since this long time (10 months time) then I discussed with my family and friends regarding his  forgery. My family and friends told me that I had been cheated by Baburam Mahapatra and also I come to know that several senior citizens people have been cheated by him.

I went several times at your Golpark office to refund my money but all time your employee Baburam Mahapatra ignored me.

I never seen like this people as Baburam Mahapatra, he destroyed my life, I have only that property which I  sold and given him as well as in Exide life insurance and lost every thing. 

Kindly cancel above policy and refund my money in my mentioned bank account immediately.

Yours faithfully,

Kalpana Dutta

The Managing Director

Exide Life Insurance

Institute Wellness Group (IWG) is organizing member selections for all students (UG/PG/RS) from 16 to 17 January. To participate in the selections of IWG, head to the following link: tinyurl.com/iwg-selections

IWG is a student body that helps promote mental well-being and interaction among the students of the Institute. It conducts relevant event, workshops and sessions that facilitate community building and create a platform that students can reach out to when needed.  IWG vividly works to provide a platform for communication and try to reach out to all groups of students with the aim of "Wellness for Everyone".  The common aim is to assist the students of the Institute to interact and collaborate in harmony and function as one.

Dear all,

Guest lecture on "Cloud Data & Management: Trends and Challenges" is being held in the Physics Department, IIT Kharagpur. Speaker for the lecture is Ms Meenakshi Kaul-Basu, Alumni of IIT Kharagpur.

The details are as follows:
Date - 12/01/19 (Saturday)
Time - 4:00 pm
Venue - H.N.Bose Seminar Room (1st Floor Physics Department)

Information about the speaker :
Meenakshi Kaul Basu graduated from IIT Kharagpur with a BS degree in Physics(Hons) in 1984. She was the first woman in all of the IITs to be elected to the student body (GSec Sports 1983-84). She then received her Master's degree in Electrical Communications Engineering from Indian Institute of Science in 1988. Since then she has worked as an engineering leader at several high tech companies including Texas Instruments, Sun Microsystems, Oracle, Siemens, Wipro, and Ericsson, her expertise lies in delivering applications and enterprise software solutions for large complex distributed web-scale systems including Cloud and High Availability. Recently she is working on an early stage startup STEM Away. Ms Meenakshi is currently the president of PAN IIT Bay Area Alumni and the IIT Foundation San Francisco Bay Area chapter making her one of the most active alumni of IIT KGP. She also organises various technical talks, conferences and other events for the alumni in the Bay Area. Ms Meenakshi Kaul-Basu is being awarded the Distinguished Alumni award.

P.S:- The Guest is expected to be on the tight schedule hence all are requested to be on time.

Since then she has worked as an engineering leader at several high tech companies including Texas Instruments, Sun Microsystems, Oracle, Siemens, Wipro, and Ericsson, her expertise lies in delivering applications and enterprise software solutions for large complex distributed web-scale systems including Cloud and High Availability. Recently she is working on an early stage startup STEM Away. Ms Meenakshi is currently the president of PAN IIT Bay Area Alumni and the IIT Foundation San Francisco Bay Area chapter making her one of the most active alumni of IIT KGP. She also organises various technical talks, conferences and other events for the alumni in the Bay Area. Ms Meenakshi Kaul-Basu is being awarded the Distinguished Alumni award.

P.S:- The Guest is expected to be on the tight schedule hence all are requested to be on time.

Smart India Hackathon 2019 is a nationwide initiative to provide students with a platform to solve some of pressing problems we face in our daily lives, and thus inculcate a culture of product innovation and a mindset of problem-solving. In order to make development a comprehensive mass movement and innovate on all fronts, MHRD, AICTE, i4c and Persistent Systems have come together to organise Smart India Hackathon (SIH) 2019. The deadline to submit ideas is 20th January. For more details please visit https://sih.gov.in/
In SIH 2019, the students would also have the opportunity to work on challenges faced within the private sector organisations and create world-class solutions for some of the top companies in the world, thus helping the Private sector hire the best minds from across the nation.

Let's kickstart 2019 with a chance to meet and play with Neymar and his team in Brazil
Yeah! You read it right!
Get out on 12th January to take part in the college qualifiers (open to boys and girls) at Tata Sports Complex.

IIT KGP Sports along with Red Bull presents Neymar Jr's Five challenge, a 5-a-side knockout tournament with a game being played for 10 minutes. The twist in this exciting affair is that for each goal scored by a team, a member of the opposition will have to leave the field.

For any queries feel free to contact:
Mayank(8979569245)

Below is the link to the Google form containing rules and for getting your team registered: 
https://goo.gl/Z2QCya

Date: 12th January
Time: 10AM
Venue: Tata Sports Complex

So hurry up and get your team registered!!

"Placement season is undoubtedly one of the most gruelling experiences you come across as a student at IIT. There is a constant attempt to allay the ever-rebounding dilemma which gets inflicted from all possible directions. Students get utterly anxious and confused sometimes."

There are persistent feelings bothering: "Alas! Someone should have told this beforehand or I should have prepared better". To aid the student community, next on our blog, we have an informative article by Shreshth Khare placed at Flipkart as Associate Business Analyst lately, on how to tackle placements with utter confidence and enthralling preparation.
Link:http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2019/01/01/330/

The aim of 'science' is not only to guide an exclusive group of brainwave antennae (read: humans) to newer discoveries. Ultimately, science is what makes humans, humans; the ability to 'think', and then act. One need not even be conventionally literate to use and appreciate Science.
Ratnottam Das, our Editor,  writes about some of the most isolated tribes, labeled 'the most carefully tended and petted of the races of savages' by everyone who set their eyes on them; who, over 60,000 years had succeeded in developing an advanced society and nurturing a fragile relationship with their pristine environment, until their eventual demise because of the Imperialists and their destructive policies. Follow the link: http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2018/12/28/the-students-of-science/

The journey to success and glory hasn't been a cakewalk just like any another victory, which is a culmination of sheer hard work and incessant practice. Here is an account of this team's expedition: "From Pawns to Queens: The Journey" by Prithwi Sinha.

"The darkest places in hell are reserved for those,
Your dystopia fed with herds of charlatans close,
Who maintain neutrality in times of moral crisis,
Even the extolled are far from being incisive."

Oblivion- the greatest bliss turned enemy of mankind, when man manoeuvres it for his selfish deeds, trying to escape from the path of diligence and settling for a complacent way of being. Next on our blog we have a brilliant work by Utkarsh Sinha, "Oblivion", elucidating God's wrath on the exploitation of this state.
Link: http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2018/12/15/oblivion/

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT KGP Sports's post. Nail biting finish by the Chess team of IIT Kharagpur bagging silver in the 4th Inter IIT Chess Meet, 2018. We Congratulate Gajendra Kumar, Koustav Chakraborty, Desai Saurabh, Sankalp Baliarsingh, Hemanth Kumar & Prithwi Sinha for their fantabulous performance. IIT Bombay and IIT Kharagpur, both of them won 5 matches and played 2 draws till the last round with a total of 12 points each. The final positions were decided in the tie breaker where IIT Bombay bagged the gold medal. Final results are as follows : IIT Bombay – Gold IIT Kharagpur – Silver IIT Guwahati – Bronze

Google Summer of Code, a global program focused on bringing more student developers into open source software development. Students work on a three-month programming project with an open source organization during their break from university.

For many of us, A successful Placement marks the culmination of a lifelong desire for wanting to be, and securing the best. But we say life’s a beautiful game, with long, rewarding leaps and slight, yet exciting setbacks helping it make the best; the most involving game each one of us will ever play. Technology Students’ Gymkhana wishes all the aspirants the very best for their upcoming Placements, and may you be able to put your best foot forward for the impending level up!
Play On!

Jay Sharma shared a post to Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's timeline. The world is evolving and people empowered with knowledge, passion and work ethics are the ones turning the wheels of change. Our Distinguished Alumni provided us with profound insights into the professional world and how to work our way up on the ladder of success. It is time to witness the greatest minds among our Alumni network at work!

Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur is organising a DJ Night from 5-8 PM on 27 November. The event is Open to All.
Let's all meet once before the winter break! Don't miss the chance to shake a leg with your friends as soon as the exam ends. No matter how this semester had been, let's not forget the mantra which drives us all. Let's all promise "Agle sem phod denge" and celebrate the grand ending of end sem frustappa. See you all.

“Expelliarmus! ..Avada Kedavra! ..Sectumsempra!”

Harry Potter: The most loved gift from the spellbinding author, J.K. Rowling. We have grown up reading and watching this whimsical world of magic and imitating the spells of our most celebrated wizards. Have you ever thought, what would it be like if Harry Potter is set in the realms of Indian context? Imparting a completely new dimension to this fiction-fantasy, next on our blog we have an imaginative poem, “Harry Potter and the Indian Conundrum” penned down by Kavya Jayanthan.
http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2018/11/24/harry-potter-and-the-indian-conundrum/

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT KGP Sports's post. “Obstacles don’t have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don’t turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it, or work around it.” - Michael Jordan. The tentative team list of IIT Kharagpur's Contingent for the 53rd Inter IIT Sports Meet to be held at IIT Guwahati is here. Congratulations to all the selected students and wish them all the very best! It's time to put all in and conquer, It's time to show what grit, perseverance and hardwork can do, It's time to Bring the GC back home! <3 #Go_For_Gold #Yo_KGP

"...Another hero, 
Another mindless crime. 
Behind the curtains, 
In the pantomime..." 
- Show Must Go On, Queen (1991)
Here's the next we have on our blog. We live in an existence where the hero not necessarily epitomises the ideals trivialised by popular works of fiction and movies. Often, this hero is as flawed and mindless as the wrong he is to set right. And this fact has been made evident several times since antiquity from the Mahabharata, to the present scene of Global polity, via the masterpieces of Shakespeare. And here, we present the 'The Flaws of Reality' penned down by Nikita Gupta
http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2018/11/17/the-flaws-of-reality/

National Education Day is celebrated to commemorate the 130th birth anniversary of Maulana Abul Kalam Azad, the first Education Minister of Independent India.

There is a workshop being organised by the administrative faculty of the institute (Deputy Director, Deans) and the student representatives to the senate (UG,PG,RS)
There will be a brief introduction about the life of Abul Kalam Azad and his contribution to the nation followed by a discussion.

Topic of the discussion: Curriculum looking ahead
Date: 11th November, 2018, Sunday
Time: 11am-12noon
Venue: Bhatnagar Auditorium, Main Building

The program will conclude with an Educational Day pledge to use the education for service of the nation.
Snacks and tea is arranged for all the attendees.

Want to relive those Android 2.3 Days (in real life)? Worry not, for Red Bull brings to you PAPER TOSS. Just like the popular game, fans and other deterrents will be added, to stop you from acing what used to be one of the best workplace pastimes.  Participants will be selected on first-come, first-served basis. Each participant gets an assured can of Red Bull, while the winner receives a Gift Hamper.  Impress your friends and colleagues (or make them green with envy) with your paper tossing skills.

Date: 23rd October
Venue: In front of Gymkhana
Time: 4:15 PM onwards

Technology Students’ Gymkhana, in association with Counselling centre and Institute Wellness Group, conducted a march on the global Mental Health Day. 

Student’s gathered in the Gymkhana were addressed by the Dean of Student Affairs who stressed on the need for awareness and acceptance in the campus. Everyone present took a Mental health pledge and strived to be more forthcoming and instill hope in whichever way possible. Student’s also made promises like being more open to family and friends and interacting with more people.

Although, the 2.2 couldn’t be covered due to rains, people did volunteer for a small march to and from the Main Building. They carried placards and voiced out their support for Mental Health for all and against the stigma that surrounds it.

This march was aimed at removing stigma associated with mental health and spreading awareness for the end of this discrimination. In a way, it did just that, and we hope in the future this emerges to make each and everyone in the campus comfortable to come forth with their issues without fear of judgement or mistreatment. Let us all strive to make Kgp a better place!

message:
7th Inter IIT Tech Meet

The Inter IIT Tech Meet will be held from 18th December 2018 to 20th December 2018 at IIT Bombay. The problem statements for the events have been released and can be found at http://inter-iit.tech/ 
Please go through the problem statements, people with relevant experience(s) can apply by sending in their applications (CV and Cover Letter- concisely containing their potential contributions and experiences- along with the valid proofs) at tech.gymkhana@gmail.com 
The subject of the email should be [Event Name] [Name] [Roll Number].
Deadline: 13th October 2018, 11:59pm

Note:
- One student can apply in at most 3 events, and they should mention the priority order in the body of each of the emails of the events they are applying to.
- Please attach the valid proofs in a single zip file.
- Please keep the cover letter concise and to-the-point, mentioning your relevant skills and potential contributions you can make.
- Since the Tech Meet is being held in December, the selected people might have to stay in campus in December based on the preparation required for the event.

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Ambar - IIT Kharagpur's post. “The Vagina Monologues” is a historic feminist play by Eve Ensler, which was first performed in 1996. The play explores consensual and nonconsensual sexual experiences, body image, genital mutilation, direct and indirect encounters with reproduction, fear, shame, ecstasy, and several other topics through the eyes of women with various ages, races, sexualities, and other differences. The performers are women from all age groups, ‘societies’ and fields of studies - who have come together to speak out. The play is an hour long. Hope to see you on Sunday, 9 PM at the Netaji Auditorium!

"There are heroes amongst us, seemingly ordinary people with extraordinary stories. Those who have overcome the odds by making the hard things easy. Of course, they have felt fear and have had moments of self-doubt. But when they have felt like quitting, they have found the support to carry on because this is what real heroes do. They turn weaknesses into strengths and that is why for these heroes, life is invincible."

Written by Yash Chandak and edited by Vanchhit Rai, here is a real story of relentless struggles, survival, and acceptance of one of our fellow KGPians which will make you question the substantiality of the problems in your life. It requires some patience to read through but the story is definitely worth it.
Give this a read: 
http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2018/10/05/heroes-amongst-us-an-invincible-person-with-an-empowering-story/

"IIT did not admit girls while we were there. The only young women to be seen were the daughters of staff members, who were strictly out of bounds. Some desperate students of us indulged in a mild flirtation with the tribal girls who came to collect firewood."
Captain Mohan Ram I.N (Retd.), class of 1958 from IIT Kharagpur and VP, TSG for session 1957-58, continues to write about his wonderful time, in the second part of his beautifully long and detailed account, under the series- "Reminiscing about the good old days!". Give this second part a full read here: http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2018/10/01/reminiscing-about-the-good-old-days-part-2/
The first part of the write-up may be found here: http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2018/09/02/reminiscing-the-good-old-days-part-1/

Career Development Center, IIT Kharagpur in association with Raymond has brought to you SUIT UP (2): Custom made tailor suits for all KGPians at discounted rates.
Interested students can come over to the venue and choose the colour combinations as per their interest.
VENUE: F-116 (Main Building)
DATE: 29th September 2018 - 02:00 PM - 10:00 PM
30th September 2018 - 10:00 AM - 10:00 PM

Unless you're living under a rock, sulking over the midsems, you're aware that the Asia Cup 2018 is underway. Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur is hosting a live broadcast of the Asia Cup Finals, 'India vs Bangladesh' at Netaji Auditorium from 5pm.
Bring along the friend who'll melt off your ears with his running commentary, the 'cricket expert' friend, who'll provide in-depth match analysis(even though he doesn't know cover from mid-wicket),  and the 'glory hunter' friend, who switches sides as soon as he is on the losing end.

TSG would like to thank Technology Film Society - TFS, IIT Kharagpur for their support.

TSG invites applications for Cup-wise CAPTAINS for Inter IIT Cultural Meet 2018 at IIT Roorkee from 27-30th December.

The avenues for application are:

Dance

Dramatics

Film & Media

Fine-arts & Design

Literary and Speaking Arts

Music

Quizzing

Deadline: 30th September 2018, 11:59 PM

Eligibility: Minimum 2 years of study in KGP except students appearing for campus placements.

Application Format:

Mail subject- [Avenue Name] Captain application [Your Name]

CV mentioning- Personal Details including Year, Positions of responsibility, GC+Competitive Fests participation. (Extremely brief with minimal descriptions attached in a word/pdf document)

Proposals- A minimum 200 word proposal on how to secure medals in events under your application genre, progressively building up on last year’s experience. Dramatics applicants are to specifically mention potential scripts for Stage Play and topics for Nukkad. (Attached as word/pdf file)

Applications without proposals will NOT be considered. Kindly adhere to prescribed format.

All the applications should be emailed to tsg.socult@gmail.com.

The National Service Scheme (NSS) was founded in 1969, the centenary year of Mahatma Gandhi’s birth. Thus the 150th birth anniversary of 
Mahatma Gandhi also marks the completion of 50 years of NSS. To mark this occasion, NSS IIT Kharagpur is organizing an essay competition.

September 6th, 2018 will go down in history as the single most important step towards making our Society even more inclusive, which upholds the ethos of our beautiful culture- valuing and embracing diversity; though this is just the beginning. Athrey Ranjith Krishnanunni and Monidipa Sengupta of Ambar - IIT Kharagpur explore the significance of and the timeline leading to this historic decision, which wouldn't have been possible without the support, hard work and struggle of the people of this beautiful country, which incidentally also involved several IITians and KGPians. We can't also ignore the fact (though it is of course almost a coincidence) that such a historic verdict was given just the day following Freddie Mercury's 72nd Birthday. As the lead singer of Queen, he was a proud homosexual and unarguably among the most famous Persons of Indian Origin(PIO). As he rightly said: ".....
Don't stop me now 'Cause I'm having a good time
Don't stop me now Yes I'm havin' a good time
I don't want to stop at all..."
Full read: http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2018/09/09/sixth-of-september-a-day-of-pride/

If you too want to submit your article for Gymkhana blog, visit the blog and click on the 'Publish Your Blog' at the right margin of the webpage. (or visit: http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2018/02/09/publish-your-blog/)

Dear all,

On the World Suicide Prevention Day, YourDOST is organizing a webinar to enlighten people with the basic knowledge of how to trounce a suicidal tendency and empower oneself by defeating the obstacles faced. An exclusive one-hour webinar with 3 subject matter experts to answer the questions asked related to this grave problem.

Date: 10/09/18
Time: 9 PM -10 PM

IIT Kharagpur has come up with this initiative to cater solution to the existing problems within the student community through active awareness about how to tackle it. Learn how we can help those around us, and in turn become better friends.

Simply register at http://bit.ly/YDSafeCastEp1 and we shall mail you a link to access and watch this session live.

Not everyone is JK Rowling. But everyone has a story.
Not everyone is Modi. But everyone is entitled to an opinion.
Not everyone is Oprah Winfrey. But everyone can inspire a laugh.
Not everyone likes to get out on stage and speak out loud.
But everyone should.
Register now- https://goo.gl/forms/yP2zkyXSKirA1Fu33
We're all gathering at 6:00 PM at V3 on 11th evening to hear your story in your voice.
Open IITs are the best platform for you to show your light to the entire KGP community.
We'll be waiting. Drop by and get your pals.
It's gonna be lot of fun!
Rules for the event:

Not everyone is Modi. But everyone is entitled to an opinion.
Not everyone is Oprah Winfrey. But everyone can inspire a laugh.
Not everyone likes to get out on stage and speak out loud.
But everyone should.
Register now- https://goo.gl/forms/yP2zkyXSKirA1Fu33
We're all gathering at 6:00 PM at V3 on 11th evening to hear your story in your voice.
Open IITs are the best platform for you to show your light to the entire KGP community.
We'll be waiting. Drop by and get your pals.
It's gonna be lot of fun!
Rules for the event:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SHx2G3Z_0GzO1J0ujzkOAbL2zGldvunSakafnK2ppbE/edit?usp=sharing

Open IIT Maths Olympiad is to be held on Sept 5, Wednesday from 9pm-12am at F-232,233 ,234,235.

Registration deadline: Sept 5, 12pm.

Note-
1. Maximum number of members in a team is 4.
2. Calculator/mobile phone/programmable gadget/food are not allowed.
3. No one is allowed to enter the exam hall after 8.30pm IST, i.e., 30 minutes before the commencement of exam.
4. Participants should not bring any rough sheet with them in the exam hall.
5. Participants should bring their own pens.

Ever wondered that how IIT Kharagpur was in the early years of its foundation? KGP back then, 60 years ago. The same place lightened up by different students, with its historic Hijli jail as the main building, no girl population in the campus, the prevalent ragging culture and a lot more. With the curiosity to travel back in time, here begins the series “Reminiscing about the GOOD OLD DAYS!”, where Captain Mohan Ram I.N (retired) class of 1958 IIT Kharagpur has penned a light-hearted account of IIT in early days. He was also the Vice President, TSG for 1957-58.
http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2018/09/02/reminiscing-the-good-old-days-part-1/

If you too want to submit your article for Gymkhana blog, visit the blog and click on the 'Publish Your Blog' at the right margin of the webpage. (or visit: http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2018/02/09/publish-your-blog/)

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur's post. Always on the lookout for that one quirk that makes you stand out? Always searching for that one thing, that would make your impact on the world? Come, meet us. Get to know what wonders might behold you behind Kshitij's closed doors. Get to know what we do, and the journey that led us here. We might just be that missing puzzle piece that you’re looking out for. Be there at Kalidas Auditorium at 9 PM. P.S. A lot of fun events and goodies await your arrival.

Maryam Mirzakhani, the first and only woman to win the Fields Medal, achieved what any woman, even from the most progressive countries is yet to. She overcame everything that was to afflict a woman in Post-Revolution Iran. Today, IR Iran is a formidable force to reckon with in STEM, and with more than 70% of their STEM Graduates being women, Maryam Mirzakhani was both the harbinger of and a testament to this change. 
Shreya Santra​, Editor (TSG), explores the almost fairytale-like life of this Mathematical Genius, which is also a tribute to her indomitable spirit. An inspirational biography for all the women who have ever fought and all the women who will fight for their rightful place in any domain.
http://www.gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2018/08/26/the-genius-of-maryam-mirzakhani/
Edited by: Ratnottam Das​, Editor (TSG)

Technology Robotix Society invites all the first year students to ROBOSOCCER 2018. Experience the thrill and the competition by letting you soccer playing robot do the talking this weekend!

For helping you make your first robot, we are also organizing two hands-on sessions, where you can build the robot using our help, and also clarify doubts regarding important concepts. Embed the following dates in your memory, and we expect to see you all there!
  
Hands On 1: 23rd August 2018, 6:30 pm, Vikramshila (V4)
Hands On 2: 24th August 2018, 6:30 pm, Vikramshila (V4)
ROBOSOCCER: 26th August 2018, 11 am, Vikramshila (V4)

Don’t miss out on this exciting opportunity! Start building your robots now!

“You can’t buy happiness but you can buy books and they are kind of the same thing”

But what if you didn’t have to buy them? What if you could just share one and find a friend in return?

IWG presents the event ‘Novel Exchange’ to set afoot this tradition. Let’s take this initiating step that’ll interweave Kgpian hearts. Come out with a book close to your heart which you’d like share and submit it. Receive another book that you’d like to read and enjoy. Meet the borrower or lender of your book to discuss it over a cup of chai or a walk around 2.2 and Congratulations, you now have two new friends!

Nominate your booklover friends to come out and do the same, there’s no better way to get those introverts out of their rooms.

Venue: Stalls in front of Gymkhana, CCD and MT

Bring a Book: 5-7 pm ; 22nd August (Wednesday)
Take a Book: 8-10 pm ; 23rd August (Thursday)

Agreement:

I hereby declare that I take full responsibility of taking care of the condition of this book and not tampering with it. I agree to return the book to its rightful owner by the third week of October. If I don’t meet the above requirements or lose the book by chance, I accept to face the consequences and return a sum of money chosen with propriety.

Google groups have been created separately for all the students which will help in effectively disseminating information to all the students. All the students will receive only those mails which concern them and all the necessary information will be provided to you in your respective groups regarding various scholarships, Internships/ Placements and other important announcements. All are requested to get added to their respective google groups at the earliest. The links to the google groups are provided below. India’s policy think tank NITI Aayog (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NITI_Aayog andhttp://www.niti.gov.in/) is organizing MoveHack 2018, a global mobility hackathon to crowdsource solutions aimed at the future of mobility in India. Envisaged to be one of the largest hackathons globally, MoveHack is focused on 10 themes and structured over three legs: online, followed by Singapore leg, and the finals in New Delhi.

MoveHack aims to bring about innovative, dynamic and scalable solutions to problems pertaining to mobility. The hackathon has a two-pronged campaign approach: 
(a) “Just Code It”: aimed at solutions through innovations in technology/product/software and data analysis, and 
(b) “Just Solve It”: innovative business ideas or sustainable solutions to transform mobility infrastructure through technology.

Move Hack is open to individuals of all nationalities, making it a truly global hackathon. Registrations are open at https://www.movehack.gov.in. The top 30 teams from the online submissions will travel to Delhi to participate in the Final Round to be held in New Delhi on 5 and 6 Sep 2018.

The winners will be announced during the Move Summit 2018, which is also organized by NITI Aayog on 7 and 8 Sep 2018 in New Delhi (http://movesummit.in/) and is being inaugurated by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India. Awards for the hackathon include recognizing top 10 winners, with a total prize of more than Rs. 2 crores.

India’s policy think tank NITI Aayog (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NITI_Aayog andhttp://www.niti.gov.in/) is organizing MoveHack 2018, a global mobility hackathon to crowdsource solutions aimed at the future of mobility in India. Envisaged to be one of the largest hackathons globally, MoveHack is focused on 10 themes and structured over three legs: online, followed by Singapore leg, and the finals in New Delhi.

MoveHack aims to bring about innovative, dynamic and scalable solutions to problems pertaining to mobility. The hackathon has a two-pronged campaign approach: 
(a) “Just Code It”: aimed at solutions through innovations in technology/product/software and data analysis, and 
(b) “Just Solve It”: innovative business ideas or sustainable solutions to transform mobility infrastructure through technology.

Move Hack is open to individuals of all nationalities, making it a truly global hackathon. Registrations are open at https://www.movehack.gov.in. The top 30 teams from the online submissions will travel to Delhi to participate in the Final Round to be held in New Delhi on 5 and 6 Sep 2018.

The winners will be announced during the Move Summit 2018, which is also organized by NITI Aayog on 7 and 8 Sep 2018 in New Delhi (http://movesummit.in/) and is being inaugurated by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India. Awards for the hackathon include recognizing top 10 winners, with a total prize of more than Rs. 2 crores.

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club's post. Hello Freshers! IIT KGP Quiz Club will be conducting a quiz solely for you on 14th August, 7 PM at V3, Vikramshila Complex. Come along for an evening full of fun and fundae! Here is the registration link for this : https://tinyurl.com/freshers-quiz-iitkgp P.S. - If you don't have three participants in your team, come along anyway! We'll help you find a team and some new friends! P.P.S - Please bring pens and a few sheets of paper along with you! P.P.P.S - Refreshments will be provided.

Ever tried to doodle characters and have struggled to start or something just seems amiss?

Spectra, IIT Kharagpur invites all the budding artists, hobbyist and aspiring cartoonist to come and learn the basics of CREATING and self-publishing COMICS!
Bring out that artistic child within you and give flight to your imagination and have lots and lots of fun. :) 
We'll see you all at S301, Main Building on 11th August. Be on time, so that you don't miss anything.

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Business Club, IIT Kharagpur's post. Greetings Final Year Junta! While we're sure you're busy preparing for placements, we have the perfect Open House for you. Business Club, in association with IIM Calcutta Consulting Club, is delighted to announce a first-of-its-kind Consulting workshop where topics ranging from Resumé-Building to Case Interviews will be discussed. Having interned at top-tier firms like Bain & Company, the speakers will surely deliver a great learning experience. Register at: tinyurl.com/bclub-consult-workshop Registration closes at 5 PM, 11 August

IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT

We have created google groups separately for all the UG Students. This will help us in effectively disseminating information to the students. All the students will receive only those mails which concern them and all the necessary information will be provided to you in your respective groups regarding various scholarships, Internships/ Placements and other important announcements from Gymkhana. This group would be continued throughout your stay at IIT KGP.

The link to your year-wise Google Group has been sent to you on ERP.
All are requested to get added to their respective google groups at the earliest.

P.S.-We are working on similar Google Groups for PG and RS students as well and you would be notified about them in a similar way.

KGP is immensely proud to host one of its illustrious alumni, Mr Aditya Sharma, one among the prestigious Forbes 30 under 30 and one of the youngest partners at McKinsey & Company, along with Mr Asutosh Mohapatra and Mr Abhishek Narain on 10th August 2018, at V1 to share their experiences, stories and insights of working at McKinsey & Company. Students' Alumni Cell is delighted to invite you to this event.

"Sapient will be conducting its PPT from 7 PM at V1, Today   (6 Aug), Vikramshila for final-year and pre-final year students. 

7 PM - 8.15 PM : Talk for final-year students (Hackathon+JumpStart launch)
8.15 PM - 9 PM : Internship talk for pre-final year students

It is mandatory for all students who have applied for the internship selections at Publicis Sapient to attend the PPT.
It is advisable for all final-year students interested in a career in product engineering and management, and software development, to attend the first talk."

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT KGP Sports's post. Winning a medal at State Sports Meet among other sports institutes is surely one of the remarkable achievement earned by our KGP Sports Fraternity. We congratulate and salute the dedication and hard work portrayed by Shivam Singh, Sairam Alla, Lokesh Reddi & Eslavath Jaga Deesh who were the part of Bronze winning 4*100 m relay team of IIT Kharagpur clocking 44.4 seconds at 68th West Bengal State Athletics Meet. Also, we appreciate performance by Sanat Kailash who got 4th in High Jump event. Many more to come. #Yo_KGP https://www.telegraphindia.com/sports/iit-win-first-medal-250154

message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana (TSG), IIT Kharagpur is organising a talk on "Effective Practices to Achieve Happily Your Life Goals" by Saamdu Chetri, PhD, who is Visiting Faculty at Rekhi Centre for Science of Happiness, IIT Kharagpur. The talk is scheduled for today, 5th August (Sunday), at 10:00 AM (IST) in Netaji Auditorium.

The speaker, Dr. Saamdu Chetri, is one of the preeminent experts in Human Resource Management, who has actively worked with several firms and organisations, in and outside Bhutan. He has drafted over 60 reports, three annual programs and carried out consultancies for UNDP, UNCDF and Helvetas. 

TSG solicits your presence for this rare and enriching opportunity. Reiterating the details:

Speaker: Saamdu Chetri, PhD
Topic: "Effective Practices to Achieve Happily Your Life Goals"
Date: Sunday, Aug 05
Time: 10:00 AM (IST)
Venue: Netaji Auditorium

The speaker, Dr. Saamdu Chetri, is one of the preeminent experts in Human Resource Management, who has actively worked with several firms and organisations, in and outside Bhutan. He has drafted over 60 reports, three annual programs and carried out consultancies for UNDP, UNCDF and Helvetas. 

TSG solicits your presence for this rare and enriching opportunity. Reiterating the details:

Speaker: Saamdu Chetri, PhD
Topic: "Effective Practices to Achieve Happily Your Life Goals"
Date: Sunday, Aug 05
Time: 10:00 AM (IST)
Venue: Netaji Auditorium

In the recent times, it is observed that the desire to have an international exposure is increasing rapidly amongst students. There are several ways through which students can go abroad. Some of them are conferences, competitions, foreign internships, semester away program, etc. To let students know about all the ways through which they can have an international exposure, International Relations Cell presents you a session on “How to Become an International Student?” .
Venue : Netaji Auditorium
Date : August 5, 2018
Time: 11 am to 12 noon 
A quote by a student after getting international exposure:
“ Coming back was never that same as it was while leaving!”
Hope to see you there!

Attention Second Years students!
We are extremely proud to announce the Guest for the Motivational Lecture scheduled on 4th August, from 6 P.M to 7 P.M at the Netaji Auditorium as part of the Assimilation Program.
Dr. Era Dutta who has conducted various seminars, talks and workshops with institutions like: NIFT, Mumbai; Leading schools - The Cathedral, Mumbai; Sushia Birla school, Kolkata; Loretto, Kolkata is coming to IIT Kharagpur to speak on "SUCCESS". She regularly conduct talks in various corporates like Amazon, Mumbai; Times Group,Mumbai; Bharat Petroleum, Mumbai; Twinnings, Kolkata; Hindustan Petroleum, Kolkata. and many more. We are looking forward to have her among us. So be there on time.
6 P.M at Netaji Auditorium, IIT KGP
Those who are not a part of the Assimilation Program but still interested to attend the Guest Lecture, are requested to occupy the last rows of the auditorium.

Details are as follows: Date: 25th July 2018 Time: 5:50 PM Venue: Kalidas Auditorium It is mandatory for all final year students (UG, PG, PhD etc) to attend. Please check the notice board for all information regarding internships and placements.

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur's post. Providing facilities gives comfort, but providing hospitality gives the feeling of familiarity! To warmly welcome freshers and assist the parents through the rigorous processes in the foreign place, Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur and Student Welfare Group - SWG, IIT Kharagpur has jointly deployed around 50 sophomores as volunteers at railway stations and halls of residence with a central help desk at Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur. You can find them in Black T-shirts with Students'Welfare written at the back. Welcome to the IIT Kharagpur Family! <3

We bet everyone is enjoying the World Cup. Well, this edition of FIFA World Cup has been quite unpredictable, to say the least!

We bet everyone is excited for the upcoming matches. But what if we said that we could make your experience more exciting?

IIT KGP Sports is delighted to announce the LIVE SCREENING of the semi-finals, 3rd place play-off and the final of the FIFA World Cup! This will surely be an experience to cherish and to celebrate the unity and togetherness among KGPians.

We are grateful to Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, for pulling cords together and for facilitating the event. We’re thankful to VP, TSG for helping us in making this event possible. We would also like to thank Wacker Metroark Chemicals and Conferencia for their radical role in organising the event.

So, get ready KGP. Come with your mates and watch these thrilling matches together.

#FIFA_World_Cup
#Come_together_for_FIFA

KGPian Aman Karan speaks his mind and his experience about alarming #RoadSafery scenarios in India.
------------------------
1/4
I was hit by a #Car in the mid-city, surprisingly before the station house (District Police HQ is located a stone's throw away).
#cops picked me up but they didn't call in an #ambulance.
#culprits ran away, not arrested yet. Perhaps #cameras were missing.

I always read #news about fatal road #ACCIDENT(s) in #India resulting in many losses everyday.. 
#life is precious, may come to a tragic end due to DEVIL-MAY-CARE driving or in a #roadrage, often occurs after a #cocktail #party.

About 150 k people die every year in #roadTrip #accidents in India, mostly because of the negligence and delay in administering #FirstAid.

From #Delhi to #PATNA and #Mumbai, street cameras are not installed to deter and catch roadhogs.
People & cab #drivers are horrible 😱

I #ChallengeModi for ensuring #RoadSafety in the country.
https://twitter.com/Aman_Karan_2011/status/1000823565523013634?s=19
/

About 150 k people die every year in #roadTrip #accidents in India, mostly because of the negligence and delay in administering #FirstAid.

From #Delhi to #PATNA and #Mumbai, street cameras are not installed to deter and catch roadhogs.
People & cab #drivers are horrible 😱

I #ChallengeModi for ensuring #RoadSafety in the country.
https://twitter.com/Aman_Karan_2011/status/1000823565523013634?s=19
/

KGPian Aman Karan speaks his mind and his experience about alarming #RoadSafery scenarios in India.
------------------------
1/4
I was hit by a #Car in the mid-city, surprisingly before the station house (District Police HQ is located a stone's throw away).
#cops picked me up but they didn't call in an #ambulance.
#culprits ran away, not arrested yet. Perhaps #cameras were missing.

message:
SPIC MACAY is presenting a precious opportunity for KGP students who are currently in the campus to attend their workshops and learn various forms of Music, Dance, Yoga, Painting, Pottery and other interesting craft skills. 
The workshops in Music includes Rabindra Sangeet, Dhrupad, Hindustani Vocal, Carnatic Vocal, Gurbani, Baul etc. Dance workshops includes Kuchipudi, Kathak, Odissi, Kathakali, Bharatanatyam, Mohiniyattam, Chhau etc. Yoga workshop would feature Hatha Yoga workshop. Other workshops includes sessions on paintings, crafts, pottery, basketry, weaving, mask making, paper cutting and wood carving. 

IIT KGP students who want to participate in this workshop and morning yoga sessions are requested to fill this google form and report to control desk in Nalanda Complex tomorrow (5/6/18) morning at 8.30 am. The seats will be filled on first come first serve basis. There is no charge for attending these workshops and yoga sessions.
Kindly don't fill the form if you want to attend the concerts only.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScCNsEkyQLa0H2WxNQX8bRvH2nJYfo-FOngkLUs5VjDk9gpqg/viewform

Hi everyone,

I would like to know about the ambiguous situation created regarding budget. It is really very irritating when judges for the internal dramatics competition ask for their payment. If you ppl don't have proper managements and budgets why did you assure the judges for the payment within 10days after competition???? They all are having busy schedule. Moreover they made some time for the kgpians. I must say that they are all professionals having their busy schedules. Its really irritating when one of the judges (My friend)  asks me about it, and he needs the money urgently. What to say??? Is it really shows " KGP ka tempo high hai???!!!"  This s creating very worst and negative impact of kgpians. 
Lastly pls guys pls sort these things asap. Its a request.otherwise it's really embarrassing for us. We are not supposed to do these things with externals / professionals.

Kgp is a magic ride for all of us. It is a mixed bag of happiness, despair, and wonders. It has never failed to Stupefy all those who have set foot here and we hope this journey has been as fantastic as Alice’s adventures down the Rabbit Hole, as magical as Harry’s stay at Hogwarts and as adventurous as Bilbo’s quest for the ring that ‘rules them all’ for the entire graduating batch. With this journey slowly coming to its end for the Class of 2018, we’d like to fill up your treasure trove of memories with the best moments of your college life. So all the Harrys, Rons and Hermiones out there, dress up as anyone and anything you like on the 28th of April and grace the Bidhan Chowk with your presence from 4:30 PM onwards. Be a superhero from the Marvel Universe or a God from Mythology or simply a Holiday Armadillo. Anything or anyone.

P.S.: Be ready to sway to the beats of the Class Song of 2018 ❤️

The camp is open to all the students of IIT KGP. 

Register now by filling the Google form:

Our fellow KGPians have now and again made the country proud with their innovative ideas being showcased at the best of the platforms in the world. This time, it’s the Team Infinity from IIT Kharagpur which bagged the third prize in the Innovation Summit Bold Ideas Competition at Paris organized by Schneider Electric, one of the biggest players in the field of renewable energy. The team consisting of Nawazish Parwez, Nihal Gupta, Soumya Dubey, Akash Kumar and Gaurav Kumar (right to left in photograph) performed exceptionally well in the first round of the competition that saw a participation of more than 240 teams from 40+ countries all around the world to secure a place among the top 10 teams to showcase their talent in the summit to be held in Paris. Their idea was based on the hybrid solar panel which increases the efficiency of the existing conventional system, using the modern principles of Materials and Environmental Engineering. The idea was appreciated by the judging panel consisting of environmentalists and scientists all around the globe.

IIT Kharagpur believes in ensuring maximum student participation and also maintaining fairness during selection of student representatives, to ensure the same, the selection of the General Secretaries (2) Students' Welfare, TSG for the academic session 2018-19 will be chosen through a voting/scoring by a 6-member faculty panel.
The student community plays a very crucial role of portraying the candidates in right spirits in front of the unbiased panel through a series of questions.
So, please attend the SOAPBOX on Monday, 9th April, 2018 from 6:15pm at Old Badminton Court, TSG to raise your voice and question the candidates. Please find the proposals attached below.
If you are unable to attend/if you are not given a chance to pose your questions in the session, you may kindly fill this form immediately even during the evening, there is a panel of unbiased moderators who would pick relevant questions and ask the candidates in public.
Link to the form: https://goo.gl/forms/C9bymNSsrh0TtNqo1

This is the first time, a system of this sort is put in place, you are expected to kindly use this opportunity in good spirits to help in selecting the right person to hold office.

Google Drive link for all the proposals of the candidates:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=161_C8Z9TTbebCHyPoFdw4btjXKW4FgwS

IIT Kharagpur believes in ensuring maximum student participation and also maintaining fairness during selection of student representatives, to ensure the same, the selection of the General Secretaries (2) Students' Welfare, TSG for the academic session 2018-19 will be chosen through a voting/scoring by a 6-member faculty panel.
The student community plays a very crucial role of portraying the candidates in right spirits in front of the unbiased panel through a series of questions.
So, please attend the SOAPBOX on Monday, 9th April, 2018 from 6:15pm at Old Badminton Court, TSG to raise your voice and question the candidates. Please find the proposals attached below.
If you are unable to attend/if you are not given a chance to pose your questions in the session, you may kindly fill this form immediately even during the evening, there is a panel of unbiased moderators who would pick relevant questions and ask the candidates in public.
Link to the form: https://goo.gl/forms/C9bymNSsrh0TtNqo1

This is the first time, a system of this sort is put in place, you are expected to kindly use this opportunity in good spirits to help in selecting the right person to hold office.

Google Drive link for all the proposals of the candidates:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=161_C8Z9TTbebCHyPoFdw4btjXKW4FgwS

Applications are invited for the following Gymkhana awards in the Social and Cultural genre :

1. For outgoing students only: 
(Best Outgoing All rounder who has performed with distinction particularly in social and cultural activities)
a) SRIMATI CHANDRAMANI CUP 
b) INSTITUTE ORDER OF MERIT (Social and Cultural)
c) HONORABLE MENTION (Social & Cultural)
d) SPECIAL MENTION (Social & Cultural)
e) ASHOKE MUKHERJEE CUP (outstanding voluntary contribution to the Gymkhana)

2. For non-graduating students :
(Best Performer in the Social and Cultural genre in the academic session 2017-18)
ALUMNI CUP

The following are the criteria for Gymkhana Awards in Social and Cultural:
1. Medals won in GC events, inclusive of individual mentions in group events(eg. Best Actor etc)
2. Medals in Freshers'/Open-IIT events.
3.Leadership roles - Positions of Responsibility in Gymkhana, Hall, Societies
4. Participation/Medals in Outstations, Inter IIT Cultural Meet & Spring Fest - Only formal events to be taken into account
5.Other commendable work in the Social and Cultural field during their stay at IIT Kharagpur.

All applicants are requested to mail their resumes carrying the above points(including supporting documents) to the id:
tsg.socult@gmail.com. Name and roll number must also be mentioned.
Deadline: 6/4/2018, 11.59 pm

Gymkhana Awards 2017-18 | Technology

Applications are invited for the Gymkhana Awards in Technology, 2017-18 for the following awards:

1. G.S. Sanyal Cup 
2. Institute Order of Merit
3. Honourable Mention
4. Ankik Dhar Trophy (Outgoing All rounder with involvement in all three events Sports and Games, Social and Cultural and Technology and exceptional performance in at least one of them)
5. Ashoke Mukherjee Cup (Outgoing student who has made outstanding voluntary contribution to the Gymkhana) 

In the resumes following information can be included:

1. Inter IIT Participation, and achievement if any
2. Intra and Inter College/University Participation in competitions, and achievement if any
3. Participation in various national and international conferences as a student of IIT Kharagpur, and achievement if any
4. Meaningful projects and technical paper publications
5. Positions of Responsibility held at the Gymkhana or any other organisation in the institute
6. Any other contribution to IIT Kharagpur at the Institute level

Any student awarded punishment by the Standing Disciplinary Committee of the Institute/Examination Malpractice Prevention Committee of the institute shall not be eligible for Gymkhana awards.

Mail your resumes and relevant documents (for the verification of credentials) to tech.gymkhana@gmail.com at the earliest.

Application Deadline - 6th April 2018, 11.59 PM.

No applications beyond the deadline will be entertained.

We come across a lot of problems, get stuck in some complicated chains and have a lot of queries every single day!
Whom should we turn to?
The answer is here! Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur has launched the Support Cell, an initiative of the current Vice-President, Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur, Mr.Mayank Srivastava. The cell would serve as the first node of information for any doubts relating to various important domains of student life ranging from mess and maintenance to mental health!
Upon approaching, this team of individuals will enlighten you regarding procedures in the respective domains and respective person(s) in-charge. The current team lead by Krushi Bandi and Yashasvi Kanchaguntla will serve its term until August, 2018.
Hope you all use the service of the team to the best!

“ The value of higher education is the not learning of many facts but training of mind to think.”
-Albert Einstein

The world is definitely a humongous stage and all humans are merely players, where the ultimate fight is for power acquisition. Everybody wants to acquire fame and engraved his / her name in the golden books of history.If statistics is taken into picture be it Mrs.Indra Nooyi, Dr. Sashi Tharoor or Dr. Manmohan Singh each of the successful Indians has one thing in common: they all are highly educated. In such times, it becomes essential for students to decide whether to pursue higher education or go for corporate jobs. International relations cell, therefore, presents the MS/ Ph.D. panel discussion to help students clear all their doubts regarding MS/ Ph.D. application procedure. Hope to see you see there!

“ The value of higher education is the not learning of many facts but training of mind to think.”
-Albert Einstein

The world is definitely a humongous stage and all humans are merely players, where the ultimate fight is for power acquisition. Everybody wants to acquire fame and engraved his / her name in the golden books of history.If statistics is taken into picture be it Mrs.Indra Nooyi, Dr. Sashi Tharoor or Dr. Manmohan Singh each of the successful Indians has one thing in common: they all are highly educated. In such times, it becomes essential for students to decide whether to pursue higher education or go for corporate jobs. International relations cell, therefore, presents the MS/ Ph.D. panel discussion to help students clear all their doubts regarding MS/ Ph.D. application procedure. Hope to see you see there!
