“If there’s something you want to build, but the tech isn’t there yet, just find the closest possible way to make it happen.” 

To apply for this internship- http://bit.ly/MARKETINGKGP

Global Entrepreneur is a purely technical internship program that provides the students an opportunity of enhancing their skills in fields of their interests by working in a startup in a foreign country for 6-8 weeks.

Some of the categories provided are:  

Data Analytics
Web Development
Programming
Engineering (specific to mechanical, civil, electrical)
Architecture
Finance
Marketing
Business development
Game development

Process :
Go through the regularly updated sheet of projects available (http://bit.ly/GEIITKgp)

Meet an AIESECer in IIT KGP.

Create an account on opportunities portal of AIESEC (www.aiesec.org)
Apply for projects
Skype interview with a startup of your liking
Pay administration fee = Rs.18,000 on approval
Book your flight tickets, apply for visa, get your travel insurance and ISIC
Attend the Outgoing preparation seminar
Have an amazing internship!

To know more about technical internships, register here:
http://www.aiesec.in/global-entrepreneur/

जिमखाना ब्लॉग में प्रकाशित रचनाओं की अगली कड़ी के रूप में प्रस्तुत है Yash Shukla द्वारा लिखी गयी यह रचना। इस सीमित दुनिया के असीमित दायरे अक्सर इंसान के हक़ों को लकीरों में कैद करना चाहते हैं। फ्रीडम ऑफ़ एक्सप्रेशन पर आजकल सेंसरशिप के ठेकेदारों और कुछ राजनितिक पार्टियों ने काल्पनिक सीमाएं बाँध दी हैं। लेकिन यथार्थ अदब के लिए अगर कलाकार को बार-बार ये सीमाएं लांघनी पड़े तो वह ज़रा भी नहीं हिचकेगा। इस कलाम में यही समझाने की कोशिश की गयी है।
http://gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in/blog/index.php/2018/03/14/inkalab-pasand/
If you too want to submit your article for Gymkhana blog, visit the blog and click on the 'Publish Your Blog' at the right margin of the webpage.

Science Education Group (SEG) in coordination with COSTISA (Coordination of Science and Technology Institutes’ Student Associations) invites you for a talk and discussion commemorating Shaheed Bhagat Singh.

Title: "Bhagat Singh's Idea of Independent India"
Speaker: Prof. Jagmohan Singh (Human right activist, Nephew of Bhagat Singh and IIT Kgp Alumnus)
Date: 14th March, 2018
Time: 6PM
Venue: S. N. Bose Auditorium, IIT Kharagpur

Facebook Event: https://www.facebook.com/events/339280816582517/

Abstract of the talk:
Shaheed Bhagat Singh - his vision of Free India and its relevance today. The talk will explore the making of Bhagat Singh in his family continuity of four generation of dedication to socio-political cause of people. There will be touching the development of Bhagat Singh's response to various social , economic and political problems of the time. How he analyzed and expressed himself on various contemporary movements. An in depth attempt will be understand how he prepared himself to be able to challenge the British Imperial rule and at the same time played a role of "a vanguard of the broad national movement." We will be understanding his practical approach in establishing youth movement which not only challenged the social basis but established a culture of freedom living. This will all based on his own writings and family information.

"Great are great because we are on our knees, let us arise. "

About the Speaker:
Prof. Jagmohan Singh, former Professor at Punjab Agriculture University, Ludhiana, an alumnus of IIT Kharagpur, has been committed to dissemination of Bhagat Singh’s ideas. Son of Bhagat Singh’s sister Bibi Amar Kaur, Professor Jagmohan Singh has digitized most of the essential writings of Bhagat Singh. He is also the founding member of the Association For Democratic Rights (Punjab), the Jamhuri Adhikar Sabha which was formed in 1978. The association was conceived as a mass-based group to carry out a firsthand investigation of the reports of violation of human rights and put it in the public domain to help people’s movements in the fight for justice.

Be there and witness the amazing performances of the professional troops from both the states. Enjoy the ​Punjab and Andhra Pradesh special food beverages Kazi Nazrul Community Centre as well.
Venue: Kalidas Auditorium
Time: 05 PM onwards
Be there!

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Enactus IIT Kharagpur's post. Enactus The Largest Community Of Students Across The Globe Making The World A Better Place Through Social Entrepreneurship. In Enactus we believe that every individual has the ability to make impact in their community - not in the form of charity - but by using the positive power of business. Participation in Enactus provides you the opportunity to make a meaningful difference in their communities, while gaining the experience, skills and contacts necessary to build a successful career. Enactus IIT Kharagpur invite you to be a part of the change. Be a part of us. Register Now: http://bit.do/enactusiitkgp Deadline of application- 11th March 2018 till midnight To know more : http://enactus.org/ #WeAllWin #Enactus

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur's post. If you go on a 2.2 tonight and find some flocks of paper notes around, just go ahead give them a glance! Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur has today organised a flash gratitude expression drive at various locations of the Scholars' Avenue which saw an overwhelming response! More than 600 students, faculty, even security and rickshaw pullers came forward to write interesting thank you notes expressing gratitude the most subtle elements/people in their lives! If you didn't get to write it this time, don't mind, its not going to be flash next time! We'll be back with the same act within a fortnight! #GratitudeMonth #ThankYouKGP #IWG

Greetings!
ZS associates in collaboration with Business Club brings to you an open house session -“Brown Bag on the Art and Science of Problem-Solving”. It will focus on understanding the most effective approaches of solving a case study. This session will also act as an introduction to the case study competition to be organized by ZS, winners of which will get Pre-Placement Interview (PPI) offers from ZS! What to wait for? Embark on the journey of honing your skills and begin your expedition into the fascinating world of consulting that might just hold your future. We have exciting goodies and refreshments that await your presence. This session is exclusively for pre-final year students. Since limited number of seats are available, register at: https://tinyurl.com/y989quod

7 PM, 6th March | V4
For any queries please contact:
Puneet: 9783611967
Aman: 7430011888

Inter Hall Gardening Competition was held on 4th March 2018 (Sunday) where all the participating Halls came up with unique ideas and themes. All the participating Halls showed great zeal and enthusiasm and with the help of staffs, they succeeded in conveying the various messages that were intended for all of us!

Results are as follow:
Gold - Azad Hall - Save girl child and women empowerment
Silver - MMM Hall - Monumental structures of IIT KGP and Konark temple wheel
Bronze - Nehru Hall - Devotional things including Maa Kali and Swastika sign
Consolation Prize - JCB Hall - Conserve water and save the earth 

We are very much thankful to our esteemed judges who took some time out of their busy schedule to judge the competition. Jury panel consisted of Mrs. Kajal Bhattacharya, Mrs. Sagarika Dasgupta and Mrs. Preeti Padma Das. They played an important role by minutely observing each and every garden and came out with unanimous decision. 

We would like to thank all the students and staff members who came up with brilliant ideas to be conveyed through flowers!

message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur's post. This is that time of the year when most of our minds run faster to catch up with the syllabus, but sadly a lot of our friends feel alone and left behind in the race! Some slip and need your help to get back! Haven't you ever felt that there is nobody to care for you in KGP? Don't let your friends feel so! Go ahead, spare some time and talk good to your neighbors! Make them feel light and ask them to take care proper care of their health, food and sleep! Boost their confidence! Motivate them! #NEEDoftheHOUR #RandomActsofKindness #Help #Motivate

message:
| Gymkhana Website - http://gymkhana.iitkgp.ac.in |

With the need of the situation and upcoming General Championship Events, we have created a dynamic website to keep you all updated about the activities we do. Apart from the basic details, we have added new features in the website
- GC and Inter IIT standings
- Quick Links to help you redirect to the relevant source of information
- Publish Your Blog: Round the year we have many incidents where many of you have valuable points and suggestions for the community. 
We want you to publish your thoughts through the site which we will put up in the blog section. Rahul Raj and Antra Saxena will be moderating the content. We have tried to cover many aspects through this central website. Few more features will be added as we progress.
CREDITS
Under Mayank Srivastava, Nishchal Kutarekar did great work on the website. Pratyush Vivek, Antra Saxena and Rahul Raj worked on the content and overall framework of the site.

We take pleasure to announce that the Students' Welfare Portfolio of the Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur has recently started the Institute Wellness Group,IIT Kharagpur.
It is a group of enthusiastic students from all years, disciplines and courses headed by the General Secretaries Students' Welfare of the Gymkhana assisted by the General Secretaries, Students' Welfare of all the halls of residence who shall be responsible to organize events for the improvement of the social culture and general wellness in the campus.
All the activities, workshops and meetings of the IWG are open to the entire KGP community (will be intimated through the facebook page) and everyone is wholeheartedly invited to engage themselves!
Like and Follow the facebook page to get regular updates and to be a part of the process that just began for "a better KGP!"

British Council, the knowledge partner for Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur, invites you to join the Digital Library. The digital library is a premium repository of books, journals, movies, live theatre, magazines, newspapers, soft skills training modules, musical concerts and much more. IIT students receive a special discount of Rs200 on the annual subscription. Offer is valid for the first 100 registrations. To register, visit https://library.britishcouncil.org.in and use promo code FAMKOL to get the Rs200 discount.’

IIT students receive a special discount of Rs200 on the annual subscription. Offer is valid for the first 100 registrations. To register, visit https://library.britishcouncil.org.in and use promo code FAMKOL to get the Rs200 discount.’

Dear UG First years students!
Before you get into your very crucial second year, we would like to remind you about your responsibilities and make you realize some forgotten and harsh facts which will help you in planning a proper career and successful stay at IIT KGP.
The UG Representative along with the Students' Welfare portfolio is organizing a compulsory sensitization program for all the freshers where in there will be valuable inputs from various deans, faculty and student representatives.
Please be on time and follow the seating pattern as shared with you by your EAA officer over mail.
See you all in Netaji at 6pm!

Hello everyone,
The Food And Mess Monitoring Committee, IIT Kharagpur is recruiting Associate Members (UG Second years).
Food Monitoring Committee and Mess Monitoring Committee is a student body for Regulating and Monitoring Mess & Commercial food Establishments in IIT Kharagpur. Its main objective is to ensure that a standard quality of food is served in all the Mess and the other food outlets inside the campus which ultimately maintains a healthy appetite among the campus community.
Sophomores whoever has a zeal to work for a good cause can register on the link: https://goo.gl/GqiYp7

Time: 6 pm onwards
Date: 7th Feb'18
Venue: Sports Library, Gymkhana

Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC) in association with Technology Transfer Group (TTG) IIT Kharagpur, has created the UG Research Portal (UGP) and it is going to be launched on 6th Feb, (7.15 pm), at Netaji Auditorium. The purpose of this portal is to engage UG students in research projects. This is an initiative to shape the budding minds of our institute for high-quality research and to foster the research culture among the UG students.

TSG takes this opportunity to invite all the members of IIT KGP community to Ek Bharat Shrestha Bharat celebrations, an initiative by the MHRD, Government of India, in our campus premises on 30 and 31 Jan 2018.

Ek Bharat Shrestha Bharat initiative is aimed at celebrating the diverse linguistic, cultural and religious traditions that hold together our composite national identity.
This is an initiative to narrow down distances in terms of connect and communication and bring about an amalgamation of cultures from different spectrums of our society. Tamil Nadu and Jammu & Kashmir will be presenting before you their cultural heritage.

It begins today at 4:00 pm in Kalidas auditorium..

Some things look very simple, they become a part of our lives, we just don't care about them!
Obsessions and Compulsions are such traits that people develop when young, which in excess, might one day harm them and the people around!
And MENTAL HEALTH IS NOT JUST Related to SUICIDAL TENDENCY! This is also a part of a person's subconscious state that can be helped or treated upon through simple counselling!
So, never think twice, go ahead and visit the Counselling Center for help!

Indian School of Business (ISB) is visiting our campus on 16th January to interact with students about YLP programme. The ISB Young Leaders Programme is a challenging foundation programme that ultimately leads to the world-class Post Graduate Programme in Management at the Indian School of Business. Over the years, the YLP has become a popular choice among college students to secure an admission to their post graduate management education during their college days itself.

For more details, register below
Interested students can attend the YLP info-session in our college
Date: 16th January
Time: 7:00pm
Venue: V1 Vikramshila
Register now for the session in our campus
For queries contact: Manish 9933931215

With great disappointment and grief i am writing this.  I donno whether this writing will have any effect or not, but I have to say. I am a border of JCB Hall. I am facing poor management and communication this year of spring fest team. I am here in iit kgp for last 7.5 years, and this 2018 is going to be my 8th spring fest. Every year i order spring fest t-shirt and/or sweat-shirt, is like a symbol of my presence or memory of staying here in iit, i preserve them with emotions.
This year i donno what is the management team is doing. When they have posted the website link http://2018.merchandise.springfest.in/. to order in this fb page, i ordered within 23 minutes. in the website it was "A Springfest representative will come to you......" and alas! NOBODY came to JCB Hall. If you are not taking orders according to the website, then what is the point of making one?? Today i called on your given contact, they are saying "the stocks are over, we are not taking anymore order, we are sorry"... Will your sorry can provide me the memento of this spring fest for my future memories??? I donno whether i will get any merchandise or not, but i am sad..

Finally, the second phase of Interaction Rooms has also started in various halls of residence making it to a total of 16 halls facilitating its own boarders.
Kindly utilize these rooms for non-academic knowledge sharing and to help each other grow as better individuals.
For any queries, complaints and suggestions regarding any Students' Welfare activities and mental health awareness, kindly reach out and inform the G.Sec of particular halls through mail and kindly cc the General Secretary, Students' Welfare of the institute Krushi Bandi bandikrushi@gmail.com and Yashasvi Kanchugantla yashasvikanchugantla@gmail.com in the mail to ensure efficient follow-up.

The workshop will be aimed at preparation of post CAT process to enter prestigious colleges to pursue MBA. Please fill up the following Google form and we will contact you shortly for the registration process.The details of the workshop will be notified after the registration process personally.
The workshop is completely free.

Link to the form: tinyurl.com/CAT17qualifiers

The Annual Alumni Meet organised by Students' Alumni Cell is back again with it's 15th edition from the 12th to 14th of January to reunite the eminent alumni of the Institute of the batches of 1968, 1978 and 1993 on the glorious eve of their Golden, Silver and Diamond jubilees. Over 300 alumni are all set to celebrate their homecoming and various enjoyable events that are planned to spread over 3 days to bring back the most dear memories etched in their life and to relive their college days.
The link of the trailer is - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7VA02x6CVyk
For further information, do visit the Facebook page of Alumni Cell: https://www.facebook.com/iitkgp.alumnicell/

When you join IIT Kharagpur, you don't just the institution, you join a family with rich culture and lots of caring people!
Halls of residence serve as the second homes and for the same, Interaction Rooms are started in several halls of residence as an initiative of the Students' Welfare, TSG where students can go to spend time, express and take advice from faculty, student representatives and other senior students in various fields!
Kindly take this opportunity to gain proper funda and create a good relation with those who "care" for you!
The details of the halls which will have their rooms functional from today are attached. Other halls shall also start their rooms soon and you will be intimated regarding the same.
The schedules, occupancy and availability of the room shall be internally circulated by the G.Sec Student Welfare in each hall of residence.

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT KGP Sports's post. Hi guys, Let's kickstart 2018 with a chance of meeting and playing with Neymar and his team in Brazil Yeah! You read it right! Come down to IIT KGP on the 13th January to take part in the college qualifiers (open to boys and girls) IIT KGP Sports along with Red Bull presents Neymar Jr's Five challenge, a 5-a-side knockout tournament with a game being played for 10 minutes. The twist in this exciting affair is that for each goal scored by a team, a member of the opposition will have to leave the field. For any queries feel free to contact SHASHANK MISHRA (+91 7431066333) Below is the link to the Google form containing rules and for getting your team registered: https://goo.gl/nRcY1H Date : 13 January Time : 9AM Venue:Tata Sports Complex So hurry up and get your team registered!!

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur and Business Club, IIT Kharagpur present the first round of the Indian Case Challenge 2018, one of the biggest case study competitions in India. Gear up to compete with the best minds in the country and prove your business acumen. Confronted with a real-life case scenario, just strong business skills and financial know-how won’t be enough. Only those with a spark of creativity and a zeal for realizing business opportunities will make it through. Wishing the best of luck to all participating teams!
The case will be sent to the registered teams via e-mail. The last date of submission for the preliminary round is 28th December 2017.
If you have not registered yet, head over to http://bclub.co.in/icc2018/register/

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post. In the wake of the recent tragic events that took place in KGP, Students’ Alumni Cell has taken an initiative along with IITKGP Foundation to raise INR 39 L ($60,000) to bring in state-of-the-art ambulance for safe and reliable medical care while en route to facilities in Kolkata. The surplus money raised will be used for student wellness and health on campus (namely mental health services). "Alumni are an integral part of the institute." True to our notions, they have always been a helping hand to KGP and have contributed significantly to its development over the years, be it the Nalanda Classroom complex or halls' development. It is in tough times like these, the true spirit of KGP emerges forth where the entire KGP family unites as a whole. As it is said in RK Hall, “A Great Place to Learn and Live,” let us make KGP a great place to learn and live. #for_a_better_kgp #every_help_counts

Greetings from Technology Students' Gymkhana!

The Smart India Hackathon (SIH) was a national level effort connecting the higher education campuses. The SIH was primarily a code-fest in which software programmers were challenged to write programmes giving innovative solutions to more than 500 problem statements. The SIH-2017 elicited an enthusiastic response with more than 40,000 students participating. It was concluded in the first week of April 2017 with Hon’ble PM addressing the participants. This is being followed with Smart India Hackathon-2018 which was formally launched details of which can be found in https://innovate.mygov.in/sih2018/.

The MHRD now proposes to expand the scope of SIH-2018 by including hardware section in it. This platform will provide an opportunity to the innovative minds to showcase their solutions at the national level. It is also proposed that the best entries at the national level would also be provided funding through the Research Parks and the Technology Business Incubators (TBIs) for product development for their eventual commercialisation/extensive social use.

The MHRD expects a good participation in this Hackathon from all the IITs and NITs.

All students are requested to provide ideas (with or without models/prototypes) that will be proposed as problem statements of the Smart India Hackathon 2018. This should be done by mailing the idea totech.gymkhana@gmail.com by 13th November, 2 AM.

You are also requested to go through the 400+ problem statements provided in the aforementioned link and register for the Hackathon. The problem statements are both software and hardware based.

Open IIT Social Case study event : 

Winning entries ideas will be implemented in the next NSS camp and winning teams will be given cash prize.So do participate and give you valuable ideas

 Problem Statement: https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B2aZLtZ3RV63dXlBdlNrc2tUbjA
 Rules : https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B2aZLtZ3RV63cTJGd2NHOS16Mms

Submissions are to be sent to tsg.socult@gmail.com along with the name and roll number.

Did you ever wanted to save your Grades and calculate your Averages with an App? Do you often forget what lesson you have next and where you need to go? Did you ever wanted to save you Homework and get reminded to do it on your Phone?

Yes? So check out the new top App for Students: iStudent int.! It is completely for free and doesn't even have adverstisment!
https://appsto.re/lu/zR5Aib.i

iStudent is the first Student-App that is available and useful to every Student ! This App isn't made for one country or one School, it's made for everyone!

iStudent is now available on the App Store and will be soon available for Android too! -> https://appsto.re/lu/zR5Aib.i
And please visit our Facebookpage!: www.facebook.com/istudentluxemburg

It includes 7 School systems for the calculation of your Grades:
- 0 - 100% (for Universities etc)
- 1,0 - 6,0 points (for Switzerland, Germany etc)
- 0 - 20 points (for France, Belgium etc)
- 0 - 60 points (for Luxemburg) 
- A+ - F (for US, GB etc)
- 1+ - 6 (for Germany etc)
- 0 - 15 points (for University, Germany etc)

FEATURES:
- save all your Tests/Grades!
- calculates all your Averages!
- choose between 7 different School-Modes/Systems!
- create as many Sections/Trimesters/Semesters as you want!
- add as many Subjects and Tests as you need!
- create your very own Schedule! ( the Room you need to go to and the Subject you have will be shown at the bottom of Page )
- save your Homework, Tests or what every you want to save!
- you can save Pictures for your Homework too!

COMING SOON:
- Interactive Periodic tabel
- Vocabulary Trainer
- 100 easy-to-go recipes
- Meme-Voter
- and much more!

This app is made for iPhone 6 and larger, on smaller devices may appear errors with the layout, in this case, please contact us on Facebook!

THIS APP IS NOT MADE FOR IPADS! 
If you want to use this App for Ipadclasses in a School, please contact us. We got a special service for this case!

Did you ever wanted to save your Grades and calculate your Averages with an App? Do you often forget what lesson you have next and where you need to go? Did you ever wanted to save you Homework and get reminded to do it on your Phone?

Yes? So check out the new top App for Students: iStudent int.! It is completely for free and doesn't even have adverstisment!
https://appsto.re/lu/zR5Aib.i

iStudent is the first Student-App that is available and useful to every Student ! This App isn't made for one country or one School, it's made for everyone!

iStudent is now available on the App Store and will be soon available for Android too! -> https://appsto.re/lu/zR5Aib.i
And please visit our Facebookpage!: www.facebook.com/istudentluxemburg

It includes 7 School systems for the calculation of your Grades:
- 0 - 100% (for Universities etc)
- 1,0 - 6,0 points (for Switzerland, Germany etc)
- 0 - 20 points (for France, Belgium etc)
- 0 - 60 points (for Luxemburg) 
- A+ - F (for US, GB etc)
- 1+ - 6 (for Germany etc)
- 0 - 15 points (for University, Germany etc)

FEATURES:
- save all your Tests/Grades!
- calculates all your Averages!
- choose between 7 different School-Modes/Systems!
- create as many Sections/Trimesters/Semesters as you want!
- add as many Subjects and Tests as you need!
- create your very own Schedule! ( the Room you need to go to and the Subject you have will be shown at the bottom of Page )
- save your Homework, Tests or what every you want to save!
- you can save Pictures for your Homework too!

COMING SOON:
- Interactive Periodic tabel
- Vocabulary Trainer
- 100 easy-to-go recipes
- Meme-Voter
- and much more!

This app is made for iPhone 6 and larger, on smaller devices may appear errors with the layout, in this case, please contact us on Facebook!

IEEE Women in Engineering Affinity Group Kharagpur Section is organizing an eventful evening on March 29, 2017 as part of International Women's Day celebration.

Women's Day Celebration with Adventure-ka-Tadka!

Indian Mountaineering Foundation (IMF) has organized India's first Mountain Film Festival at its headquarter in New Delhi on 11th and 12th February 2017. After the screening in Delhi, IMF has compiled the best films and is running them on a tour across India.
The India Tour will take a halt at IIT Kharagpur Campus on March 29, 2017.

Get ready to CLIMB. Enjoy the RIDE with us. Go SLIDING. FLY high while seated. See the FIGHT FOR OUR ENVIRONMENT. Get INSPIRED. GO HIGHER THAN YOU'VE EVER DARED TO GO...
Please register yourself for the unique experience.

Follow the link below:
http://tinyurl.com/IMFMFF-INDIATOUR-IITKGP

March 29, 2017
Netaji Auditorium, IIT Kharagpur
6:00 PM onwards

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo. Congratulations to Team Aerial Robotics of IIT Kharagpur for their prize-winning performance in the "International Aerial Robotics Competition", Asia-Pacific Venue during 23-24th September, 2016 in Beijing China. They were awarded "Best Team Cooperation Award" for their efforts out of total 9 teams from China and India (only our team from India). The team members are: Soumyadeep Mukherjee, Aditya Agarwal, Gaurav Gardi, Kumar Ankit, Kumar Krishna Agarwal, Manash Pratim Das, Sai Ram, Vishnu Sharma It is a research group sponsored by the Institute through SRIC as part of Centre for Excellence in Robotics. The principal Investigator for the project is Prof. Somesh Kumar (MA) and it is mentored by Prof. Jayanta Mukhopadhyay (CSE) and Prof. D.K. Pratihar (ME).

message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur's photo. Carrying on this novel approach of rediscovering ancient Indian history, the Institute in association with Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur has organized a lecture under the Science and Heritage Initiative (SandHI) titled 'Astronomical Dating and Re-evaluating Ancient Indian Chronology' by Professor Amitabha Ghosh. Date: October 3, 2016 (Monday) || Time: 5:30 P.M. Venue: Kalidas Auditorium Prof. Amitabha Ghosh is Former Director and Distinguished Professor, IIT Kharagpur, Platinum Jubilee Senior Scientist of The National Academy of Sciences India. You are cordially invited to be part of this rediscovery of ancient Indian heritage through scientific means. Let us trace back our roots which would strengthen our identity as Indians and global citizens.

You can get full funding and complete support to implement your ideas. In the Introductory seminar, you'll get to know how you can propose your idea, get in touch with professors and involve with MNFIC to implement it. Be there. At time. Design Credits: Prerit Gupta​

message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Metakgp's post. Greetings, fine citizens of the realm! We hope your mid-semester exams went well. As the library site was down for most part of mid-semester exams, our site MFQP was also rendered to be down for the first few days, but we found a way out so that we could keep serving papers to everyone in KGP! Now, let's all contribute, and increase the papers MFQP has. Our Paper Collection Drive starts today! We request everyone to submit their mid-semester question papers. Here's how you can contribute - Click, Upload & Send. 1. Take a picture of your question paper 2. Write Subject Code in email 3. Send to metakgp-qp@googlegroups.com And, do visit http://metakgp.github.io/mfqp-source/ Never go to an exam without having had a look at the previous year's paper! Let's all work towards achieving that goal. That's all folks! Have a nice week ahead!
story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Metakgp's post.

Some basic rules for the event are:

2. Only water base , poster colors and markers are allowed.
3. Spraying and handprints are allowed.
4. Brushes of all kinds are allowed.

Contact Siva Ram for any other doubts(8348995558)

प्रिय विद्यार्थियो, संस्थान के समस्त आदरणीय कार्मिकगण,
हिंदी दिवस 2016 आयोजन की श्रृंखला में संस्थान में अनेक कार्यक्रम आयोजित किए जा रहे हैं। इसी क्रम में दिनांक 26 सितम्बर 2016 को शाम 1500 बजे से एक कार्यक्रम- “मातृभाषा काव्य पाठ प्रतियोगिता, काव्य संध्या, एवं साहित्यिक गीतों की संगीतमय प्रस्तुति” का किया जा रहा है। इस कार्यक्रम में संस्थान छात्रों, कार्मिकों एवं उनके परिवारीजनों सहित उनके मित्रगणों का भी स्वागत है।
इस प्रतियोगिता में आप अपनी मातृभाषा में एक कविता स्वयं की लिखी हुई अथवा किसी प्रतिष्ठित कवि की रचना प्रस्तुत कर सकते हैं। न्यायमंडल के रुप में कोलकाता से सुप्रतिष्ठित कवि ऋषि श्री योगेन्द्र शुक्ल, काव्य मर्मज्ञ प्रो. प्रेम शंकर त्रिपाठी, सुप्रसिद्ध गजलकार श्री नंद लाल रोशन तथा टाटानगर से अतिसम्मानित गीतकार प्रो. शेष नाथ सिंह एवं श्री शैलेष जी को आमंत्रित किया गया है। प्रतिभागियों के काव्य पाठ के पश्चात न्यायमंडल के सदस्य युवा प्रतिभागियों के लिए सुझाव एवं परामर्श देंगे तथा अपनी चुनींदा रचनाओं का पाठ करेंगे।
हमारे साहित्यिक गीत हमारी सांस्कृतिक धरोहर हैं। श्री ओम प्रकाश मिश्र जी अखिल भारतीय स्तर पर साहित्यिक गीतों की संगीतमय प्रस्तुति के लिए जाने जाते हैं। एक अनूठा आयोजन एवं अद्भुत अनुभव रहता है श्री मिश्र जी को सुनना और हर आंख भर आती है जब वे माँ, पिता, भाई, बहन, बिटिया, पुत्र, परिवार, समाज, बदरिया, किसान आदि पर बच्चन, नागार्जुन, दिनकर, यश मालवीय, ओम व्यास, आचार्य विष्णुकांत शास्त्री आदि परम पूज्य साहित्यकारों की रचनाओं की संगीतमय प्रस्तुति करते हैं।
आपसे निवेदन है कि काव्यपाठ प्रतियोगिता हेतु अपनी एक सर्वश्रेष्ठ कविता, गीत तैयार कर सहभागिता करें। rajbhasha@hijli.iitkpg.ernet.in अथवा hindiofficeriitkharagpur@gmail.com पर अपना पंजीकरण अनिवार्यतः कराएं। विजेताओं को आकर्षक पुरस्कार हिंदी दिवस समापन समारोह में किसी अन्य दिन दिए जाएंगे।
कृपया इस संदेश को अधिक से अधिक साथियों, मित्रों, परिवारों, समूहों तक पहुंचाएं।
निवेदक
अध्यक्ष
राजभाषा विभाग
भारतीय प्रौद्योगिकी संस्थान खड़गपुर
81718, 81864, 9641049944 9564156315

message:
**Internship at ItsOhkay**
The social initiative is commencing its internship program! (www.itsohkay.in)✌

Take a step forward towards contribution in social welfare.
This will not only provide you an amazing experience but will also credit you with an "experience letter" to add great value to your resume! :)
Also, you can choose your own domain of internship from the specified options;
link to apply : goo.gl/u8Mphp

A work from home internship in different fields:
1. Content writing
2. Content designing (memes,etc.)
3. Marketing and promotion

Eligibility for experience letter : minimum 45 days of work.

After applying, you'll be informed via mail about the selection process.

For any queries, contact :
8447495001
9654388932

or can mail @ info@itsohkay.in :)
